## HAL - 2001: A Space Odyssey

One of the best examples of an AGI in fiction is the HAL 9000 Computer from the 1968 movie “2001: A Space Odyssey” by Stanley Kubrick and Arthur C. Clarke [sci-fi writer, scientist, first person to realize the significance of geosynchronous orbit]

## Knowledge Navigator - Apple

Another prescient depiction of AI/AGI was released by Apple Computer in 1987 – set  approximately 25 years in the future: circa 2010.  Predicted innovations in this six minute video include: portable “laptop” computers with flat-screen touch-sensitive color displays, wireless networking, a version of the internet, video conferencing, small solid-state storage devices.  And a “Knowledge Navigator”...
